name: congress
content:
congress noun
(MEETING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C, + sing/pl verb ] a large formal meeting of representatives from countries or societies at which ideas are discussed and information is exchanged: an international/medical congress the congress of the Australian Council of Trade Unions Compare
awayday mainly UK
conclave
conference (MEETING)
consultation
convention (MEETING)
convocation formal
forum (MEETING)
meeting
seminar
summit (MEETING)
symposium formal
More examplesFewer examplesWelcome to the party's triennial congress.They met at a legal congress.Next year's congress will take place in Delhi.

congress noun
(SEX)
[ U ] formal the act of having sex: Congress had not taken place. They had engaged in sexual congress.
More examplesFewer examplesNo child had resulted from that congress.He said he and his wife had very infrequent sexual congress.a four-letter word often used to refer to sexual congressan act of marital congress
the elected group of politicians in the US who are responsible for making the law, consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives: Both houses of Congress have rejected the recent presidential proposal on gun control.
More examplesFewer examplesCongress voted against the measures.He spoke to Congress about the war.Congress will decide whether to give funding or not.

a formal meeting of representatives from countries or organizations at which ideas are discussed and information is exchanged: the fourth congress of the European Association for Lexicography
politics & government the elected group of people in the US who are responsible for making the law, consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives: Congress has rejected the president’s plan. congressional adjective [ not gradable ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/kənˈɡreʃ·ən·əl/
a congressional committee
Add to word list
Add to word list
GOVERNMENT, POLITICS the elected group of politicians in the US who are responsible for making the laws. Congress consists of the Senate and the House of Representatives: Established by Congress to protect investors, the SEC monitors publicly traded interests.
MEETINGS a large formal meeting of people who represent different organizations, countries, etc., at which ideas are discussed and information is exchanged: The union's annual congress voted on a resolution demanding that the government increase minimum wage levels. the congress of the International Press Institute
POLITICS a group of people who are elected to govern in some countries: The Brazilian congress discussed reopening the inquiry.
